bill_title: allow a person over seventy years of age to establish a permanent exemption from jury service.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow a person over seventy years of age to establish a permanent exemption from jury service. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 16-13 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person who is over seventy years of age may establish a permanent exemption from jury service by filing a signed statement with the clerk of court affirming that the person is over seventy years of age and desires a permanent exemption from jury service. The clerk of court shall maintain a register of the names of those persons that have a permanent exemption pursuant to this section. The name of a person on the register may not be placed on the master jury list. Any person who has claimed a permanent exemption from jury service because the person is over seventy years of age may rescind the exemption by filing a signed request for rescission with the clerk of court. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
